description: From Latin intrudere, from in- + trudere (“to thrust”).

verbs.description: intrude (third-person singular simple present intrudes, present participle intruding, simple past and past participle intruded)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To thrust oneself in; to come or enter without invitation, permission, or welcome; to encroach; to trespass.
examples: to intrude on families at unseasonable hours; to intrude on the lands of another
